title: Sleepy's Mattress Redesign
content:
Yesterday's ten-hour drive from Philly to Boston afforded me ample time to check out the billboards that spangle I-95. Probably the most interesting thing I happened upon was the redesign of the sort-of-familiar Sleepy's Mattress mascot.

Before:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014144432im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_4031.gif)
  
After:  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014144432im_/http:/typophile.com/files/I8G66J6DX81PYJPJS8P_5698.gif)

My wife and I only saw one billboard (out of about a dozen) that still sported the old character. A simple case of [the Brawnies](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014144432/http:/www.usatoday.com/money/advertising/2003-10-22-brawny_x.htm), or am I reading too far into this?
author: Ehague

comments.content: Hitler just wasn't selling mattresses like he used to, I guess.
Terrific, it was done with a piece of [Laughingbird Software](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014144432/http:/www.thelogocreator.com/MegaPak.htm).
